results.title: Play is the work of young children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Crommie and Crommie, David Crommie and Karen Crommie
results.brief_description: Lenore Wilson discusses her educational philosophy as she is shown working with children in groups and individually. Classroom scenes show the children working on a building project, moving freely around the room and acting out adult roles in their play.

results.title: Play in the snow
results.brief_description: Teaches good health habits and encourages wholesome social relationships by depicting the activities of three small children on several cold, winter days in a New England town. The children build a snowman, make snowballs and go coasting and skiing. In all these activities the children practice rules of safety and good sportsmanship.

results.title: Play Bridge with Omar Sharif
results.brief_description: Play bridge with Omar Sharif is an exciting video where you bid and play fifteen challenging bridge hands with Omar Sharif as your partner. During the program, Sharif, a world class bridge champion, offers his personal playing tips while Grand Master Truscott adds her expert commentary on bridge strategy.

results.title: Play better golf. Part II. Advanced
results.brief_description: Lloyd Mangrum, Sam Snead, Patty Berg and Jim Ferrier show applied techniques in overcoming hazards and obstacles likely to be encountered on the course - high grass, water hazards, tree blocks and sand traps. Special attention is paid to proper clubs, chip shots and putting.

results.title: Play better golf. Part I. Fundamentals
results.brief_description: Championship players, Lloyd Mangrum, Sam Snead, Patty Berg, and Jim Ferrier illustrate, by slow motion, sequences and close-ups, the three fundamentals of good golf - correct grip, aim and swing.

results.title: Play-clay
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, Peter Erik Winkler and Mary Anna Winkler
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows how flour, salt and water can be combined to make an inexpensive modelling clay. Explains how to make and decorate various things with it. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Platypus: World's strangest animal
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Discovery Channel, David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook
results.brief_description: Wildlife cinematographers David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook have created, with the help of research scientists, a rare glimpse into the predominantly underwater and underground world of the strangest of animals - the platypus. Filmed in the wilderness of Tasmania, learn about the habits and habitats of this wonderful creature - with a bill, webbed feet, venomous claw and egg laying ability. Actual footage of infant platypus occupying the nest/burrow and shows the care the mother gives her young. Narrated by Peter Thompson. Special feature also available on this disc is a documentary “Bobby and the Banded Stilts” (exec. prod. Dione Gilmour, 28 min, 1997) about birdlife in Western Australia, narrated by Hugo Weaving.
